intro: Cephalocarpus diffusus, commonly known as the spreading headfruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rounded fruit that resembles a small head, hence its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cephalocarpus diffusus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
